Title: Colophon
Medium: ink and pigments on laid paper
Inscriptions: [Transliteration] katabahu 'abd min 'ibād Allāh 'azza wa-jalla wa-anā al-faqīr al-haqīr /1/ al-mudhnib al-dhalīl al-da'īf Salīm al-Rashīd /2/ ghafara Allāh dhunūbahu wa satara 'uyūbahu Allhumma /3/ ihfaz li-sāhibih wa-kātibih wa-qāri'ih /4/ wa-li-man nazara fīhi min al-afāt wa-al-'ilal āmīna /5/ yā rabb al-'ālamīn qad tamma al-farāgh min tahrīr /6/ h<ā>dhihi [sic] al-Shifā' al-sharīf li-sittat /7/ 'ashar min shahr Shawwāl al-mubārak /8/ ba'da al-zuhr min yawm al-ahad /9/ li-sanat ihdá wa-tis'īn /10/ wa-mi'ah wa-alf min hijrah /11/ man lahu al-sa'ādah /12/ wa-al-'izz wa-al-majd / 13/ wa-al-sharaf /14/
Description: This folio from Walters manuscript W.586 contains a colophon that gives a short title of the work, the name of the scribe, and the date of copying.
Keywords: Arabic; Islamic; Ottoman; Turkish; Book; Calligraphy; Codex; Colophon; Headpiece; Illumination; Manuscript; Contemporary Binding; Turkey; History; Astrology
Provenance: al-Sayyid Abu Bakr al-Hilmi, 1281(?) AH/AD 1864-1865 [mode of acquisition unknown] [seal impression with the name and date on fol. 1a]; Henry Walters, Baltimore [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Creator: Abu al-Fadl 'Iyad ibn Musá al-Yahsubi al-Bahili (died 544 AH/AD 1149)
